title: Introduction to Currency and Commodity Markets
description: Explore the basics of trading in the forex (currency) and commodity (gold, oil, etc.) markets.
introduction: Beyond stocks, there are other important financial markets that offer different opportunities and risks. Understanding currency and commodity markets can help diversify your investment portfolio.

forexMarket.title: Forex (Foreign Exchange) Market
forexMarket.description: The largest financial market in the world, where currencies are traded.

basics.title: Basics of Forex Trading
basics.p1: Forex trading involves buying one currency while simultaneously selling another.
basics.p2: Currencies are always traded in pairs (e.g., USD/INR, EUR/USD).
basics.p3: The first currency in the pair is the base currency, the second is the quote currency.

majorPairs.title: Major Currency Pairs
majorPairs.p1: The most actively traded currency pairs include:
majorPairs.pairs: EUR/USD (Euro/US Dollar), GBP/USD (British Pound/US Dollar), USD/JPY (US Dollar/Japanese Yen)

factors.title: Factors Affecting Currency Prices
factors.factors: Interest rates, economic data, political stability, central bank policies, trade balances

commodityMarket.title: Commodity Markets
commodityMarket.description: Markets where raw materials and primary goods are traded.

categories.title: Main Commodity Categories
categories.energy: Energy: Crude Oil, Natural Gas, Coal

tradingMethods.title: How to Trade Commodities
tradingMethods.methods: Futures contracts, ETFs, commodity stocks, physical ownership

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.takeaway1: Forex is the largest financial market, trading currency pairs.
keyTakeaways.takeaway2: Commodities include metals, energy, agriculture, and livestock.
keyTakeaways.takeaway3: These markets offer diversification but come with higher volatility.
keyTakeaways.takeaway4: Understanding these markets can enhance your overall investment strategy.
